awd_titl_txt: Statistical Problems in Large Volatility Matrix Estimation and Quantum Annealing Based Computing
awd_abstract_narration:
As the modern "data deluge" grows, the importance of statistics continues to increase, and uses of statistical methods rapidly evolve. The new era of data science poses great challenges to traditional statistical tools and computational techniques; yet, at the same time, the data deluge presents unprecedented opportunities to statistics. This project plans to advance research at the frontiers of science with innovative statistical and computational approaches that address the challenges encountered in handling complex problems with big data. The project's statistical research on quantum computing and high-frequency finance will address practical problems, and the projects will create advanced effective statistical tools with direct applications in fields including finance, quantum computation, and quantum information. 
 
This project seeks to conduct novel research on quantum annealing and statistical inference about large-dimensional matrices. The goals entail developing statistical methodologies, computing techniques, and theories for (i) statistical inference for large diffusion covariance matrices with applications to high-frequency finance, and (ii) statistical research on quantum annealing in quantum computation and quantum information. The project will develop rigorously-supported statistical methods and computational techniques, furthering the theoretical underpinning of these important topics.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences

por.por_cntn:
In the era of data science, data driven and evidence based research poses great challenges to traditional statistical tools and computational techniques, and at the same time, it presents unprecedented opportunities to statistics. The principal investigator addresses the emerging problems from frontiers of scientific studies with innovative statistical and computational approaches to confront the challenges encountered in dealing with complex problems with big data. The conducted novel research projects on quantum annealing and financial statistics are in response to the challenges for solving practical problems, and he has developed statistical methodologies, computational techniques, and fundamental theories for the problems, with applications in finance and quantum information science. The research findings are novel statistical results in quantum tomography and quantum annealing and associated MCMC and data augmentation based algorithms in quantum computation. In particular, the developed large density matrix estimation techniques provide new methods and theory for quantum tomography, and the quantum annealing work offers new approaches and insights for annealing-based quantum computation. The research findings include realized GARCH-Ito models to accommodate unified modeling of key volatility features and jumps as well as to draw combined statistical inferences for low-frequency and high-frequency financial data. The research outcomes provide theoretically-supported statistical methods and computational techniques for the research problems and shed new light on computational and theoretical understanding to the research projects. 

 


Last Modified: 04/07/2022
Modified by: Yazhen Wang
